image.altText: Ange Postecoglou claps from the dugout

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou is sacked as manager of English Premier League team Tottenham Hotspur, just two weeks after he delivered the north London club its first silverware in 17 years.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou sacked as Tottenham manager two weeks after Europa win

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou in a Spurs tracksuit following a Premier League match.

props.synopsis: Tottenham Hotspur's decision to sack coach Ange Postecoglou sparks sympathy and outrage as the football world digests the news of the Australian's departure from the English Premier League club.

title.children: 'Absolutely bonkers': Spurs face backlash over Postecoglou sacking

image.altText: Donald Trump reuters

props.synopsis: It's a rocky road for global financial markets and most are treading very carefully.

title.children: Australians could enjoy an upside from US economic policy uncertainty

image.altText: Musk with Trump

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Elon Musk are at loggerheads over the US president's major tax and spending bill, which the tech billionaire believes will load America with unsustainable debt.

title.children: Trump shuns call with Musk and considers selling Tesla

image.altText: Clare O'Neil

props.synopsis: In a frank interview with the ABC, Housing Minister Clare O'Neil declared that Australia has made it "uneconomic" to build homes.

title.children: Housing Minister declares Australia has made it 'uneconomic' to build homes

image.altText: A satellite image shows three destroyed aircraft sitting on a tarmac that runs between verdants strips of grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's online army is normally supportive, but some accounts have been boldly outspoken and willing to question, even blame, the Russian establishment for not protecting the country's prized strategic bomber fleet.

title.children: As Russian planes burned, Putin's military bloggers were 'choking with hurt'

image.altText: Priya sign

props.synopsis: The federal government has promised to close the loophole that allowed employers to cancel paid parental leave after a stillbirth or early infant death.

title.children: Law to change after mother's paid parental leave cancelled when baby died

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Police say they have found what is believed to be human remains in the search for missing Queensland teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: Police say remains found in search for Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a cardigan smiles next to a young man who looks similar to him.

props.synopsis: The Australian engineer spent four years languishing behind bars before being released on bail late on Thursday night, along with an Egyptian colleague.

title.children: Robert Pether 'unrecognisable' after release from Iraqi prison, wife says

image.altText: A young girl lies with her head down in front of flower tributes.

props.synopsis: Who could investigate Kumanjayi White's death? Calls are growing for an independent probe into the death of the young Aboriginal man — but who could it be handed to?

title.children: If NT Police doesn't investigate Kumanjayi White's death, who could?

image.altText: A group of punks wearing Dr Martens milling on a street corner

props.synopsis: Dr Martens, known for its punk roots, released its financial forecast on Friday amid concerns the brand may be on the brink.

title.children: The financial fall of anti-capitalist icon Dr Martens

image.altText: A couple hold up peace signs to the camera.

props.synopsis: Across China, a growing number of young heterosexual women are fed up with traditional pressures around marriage and sexism and choosing to stay single.

title.children: China's falling birth rate meets a #boysober dating revolution

image.altText: A cream coloured building with a sign reading ‘Al Azhar University Gaza’ surrounded by rubble.

props.synopsis: Palestinian academics who fled Gaza after the war say a "generation of students" has been lost due to the conflict.

title.children: How Gaza has 'lost a generation' of students

image.altText: A woman looks into the distance with a sad face

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who lost money in a Byron Bay real estate fraud case vows to be in court when the agent is sentenced, after she was ordered to return to Australia from the United States.

title.children: Woman who lost money to fraud wants to look real estate agent 'in the eye'

image.altText: The Pitt HBO max

props.synopsis: If you have had the unfortunate need to turn up to an emergency department, I hope that it is not because in Australia in 2025, you can't afford to go anywhere else.

title.children: 'It's absolutely true': Australian emergency room doctor watches The Pitt

image.altText: A tornado near Ballarat in Victoria in 2007.

props.synopsis: Most people associate tornadoes with the United States, but as many as 80 touch down in Australia each year.

title.children: Australia has up to 80 tornadoes a year, but many go unseen

image.altText: Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell pose for a photograph in a party

props.synopsis: The bromance between President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk blown up with an unsubstantiated accusation about the Epstein files. Here's what to know.

title.children: Elon Musk says Donald Trump is in the Epstein files — here's the background

image.altText: An Australian warship in the middle of the ocean with another warship in the distance background.

props.synopsis: The Department of Defence has acknowledged that HMAS Canberra accidentally took out a number of wireless internet and radio services across New Zealand.

title.children: Australian navy ship accidentally blocks internet and radio in NZ

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: The toppling of Tasmania's premier has drawn strong reactions from across Australia. Some are calling it a "fiasco" while others say the turmoil has turned the state into the nation's "laughing stock".

title.children: Australia reacts to Tasmanian political 'clown show'

image.altText: Six family members walk down steps outside court

props.synopsis: The families of children killed in the Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy of 2021 have reacted with dismay and anger after the charge of failing to comply with health and safety requirements was found to be unproven against the castle's operator.

title.children: Families 'broken' after not guilty verdict in Hillcrest jumping castle case

image.altText: a man dressed in orange prison garment and balaclava is led away by an indonesian police officer

props.synopsis: In a short statement given to media on Friday, Stephanie Ahchee thanked Indonesian authorities for their "professionalism and impartiality".

title.children: Accused Australian drug smuggler's family wants a 'just outcome'

image.altText: Two women embrace, standing against a black background. They have serious expressions and both wear saris.

props.synopsis: India's Narmada River was the lifeblood of countless farmers and villages until a dam project caused a massive ecological disaster. It's now the subject of a new Australian play.

title.children: Up to 500,000 Indians were displaced by a dam. Their story is now a play

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab kneels down among a scattered mass of cardboard boxes.

props.synopsis: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, which last week started handing out meals to hungry Palestinians inside the war-shattered Gaza Strip, said the sites would be reopened, but did not provide a date.

title.children: US-backed Gaza aid group closes all distribution sites after shootings

image.altText: Fire and smoke rise in the city after drone strike in Kyiv

props.synopsis: Russia has mounted an intense and sustained barrage on the Ukrainian capital following Kyiv's most audacious attack on its neighbour since the war began.

title.children: Four killed and 20 injured in Russia's overnight attack on Kyiv

image.altText: Manele in chair

props.synopsis: The Solomon Islands government blocked a group of Taiwanese officials from entering the Pacific country earlier this year, stirring fresh concerns in Taipei that it might be locked out of a key regional meeting in Honiara later this year.

title.children: Solomon Islands bars Taiwan delegation, sparks alarm ahead of Pacific Islands Forum

image.altText: A selfie of Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya with a view of Hobart below them

props.synopsis: The two Queenslanders were due to leave Tasmania on Wednesday, but didn't board their flight home to Brisbane.

title.children: Two Queensland tourists thought to be missing in Tasmania

image.altText: A woman with blonde, frizzy hair wears spectacles and smiles as she takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: High school teacher Karly Rae, 36, has been released from custody after telling a NSW court she stands a high risk of developing complications during her pregnancy.

title.children: Teacher accused of sex with boy, 15, granted bail due to pregnancy

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open in a parliament ripping a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's parliament hands record suspensions to three Indigenous Māori MPs after they performed a haka to protest a controversial bill last year.

title.children: Māori Party MPs receive record suspensions over haka protest

image.altText: A picture of smiling Chloe Hayden's face alongside a palomino horse's face.

props.synopsis: The Heartbreak High actor and disability advocate shares how she is learning to rest and make room for what she loves beyond work.

title.children: 'I love being in the bush': Chloé Hayden on finding balance in a busy life

image.altText: A man in a formal suit stands in front of a PNG flag.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's peak anti-corruption body is on the brink of implosion, senior staff say, as its Australian and New Zealand bosses accuse each other of criminal activity.

title.children: PNG police issue arrest warrant for Australian anti-corruption boss

image.altText: Two people stand outside a court building with banners in the background

props.synopsis: Three climate activists who planned to release stench gas in an attempt to cause the evacuation of a Woodside annual general meeting in Perth's CBD have been fined $10,000 each.

title.children: Climate activists fined $10k each after Woodside stench gas media stunt

image.altText: The interior of a large industrial plant

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has set aside another $384 million to keep the Whyalla steelworks running next financial year — doubling the amount already allocated to keep the plant operating during administration.

title.children: $384m contingency to keep Whyalla steelworks afloat

image.altText: Two men in a screenshot from CCTV hold jerry cans outside a building

props.synopsis: Officers from the Joint Counter-Terrorism Taskforce raided at least three homes in Melbourne's north today in relation to a fire at the Adass Israel synagogue in December last year.

title.children: Homes raided by terror taskforce investigating Adass Israel synagogue fire

image.altText: A man in a black hoodie opens the door of a white car

props.synopsis: In 2023, a shot fired by Kamal El Jamal went through the garage ceiling, the floorboards of the above bedroom and through the mattress before hitting his partner who was laying on the bed.

title.children: Woman will never walk again after partner shot her through garage ceiling

image.altText: A woman seeking at a press stand-up.

props.synopsis: Cairns Mayor Amy Eden is under fire for saying she had conducted online checks on retirement village residents opposed to a controversial change that will see huge council rate hikes.

title.children: Retirement village residents facing 800pc rate hike accuse mayor of spying
